column1: Bresso (Milanese: Bress [ˈbrɛs]) is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Milan in the Italian region Lombardy
column2: located about 8 kilometres (5 mi) north of Milan. At the 2001 census the municipality had a population of 26
column3: 255 inhabitants and a population density of 8
column5: making it the most densely populated comune in Italy outside the Province of Naples.

column1: Bresso borders the following municipalities: Cinisello Balsamo
Milan's general aviation airfield is located at Bresso and is the home of the Aero Club Milano  and Aero Club Bresso.
Bresso Airport is in the commune.
